data.title: Costs of consideration of Planning Applications and Appeal by Sir Richard Hotham Project - a Freedom of Information request to Arun District Council
data.meta_description:
Please inform me re:

1.  Costs to Arun in dealing with the planning applications from the Sir Richard Hotham Project re Regeneration Proposals for Bognor Regis - this to include as far as can be ascertained, an estimate of staff costs.

2.  The cost to Arun of the Appeal to the Planning Inspector, also  this to include as far as can be ascertained, an estimate of staff costs.

3.  Any award of costs against Arun so far agreed.

4.  Income Fee from SRHP for both applications.

Concerning rules re time/cost please comply up to the point that either rule would apply.

Yours faithfully,

Jan Cosgrove
data.text:
Dear Mr Cosgrove

Thank you for your Information Request received on 15 July

2018.

REQUEST:

1. Costs to Arun in dealing with the planning applications from the Sir

Richard Hotham Project re Regeneration Proposals for Bognor Regis -

this to include as far as can be ascertained, an estimate of staff

costs.

2. The cost to Arun of the Appeal to the Planning Inspector, also this

to include as far as can be ascertained, an estimate of staff costs.

3. Any award of costs against Arun so far agreed.

4. Income Fee from SRHP for both applications.

Concerning rules re time/cost please comply up to the point that either

rule would apply.

RESPONSE:

1. Arun District Council does not record time spent on individual

planning applications and, therefore, the information you have

requested is not held for the purposes of the Freedom of Information

Act 2000.

2. Arun District Council does not record case officer time on appeals and

individual planning applications and, therefore, the information you

have requested is not held for the purposes of the Freedom of

Information Act 2000.

3. No award of costs against Arun District Council has been agreed so

far.

4. BR/26/15/PL = Total fees received = £90,193.00

BR/156/16/PL = No fees received

Arun District Council also received monies for the Planning Performance

Agreement (PPA) income of £16,000

If you are dissatisfied with the way your request for information has been

handled, you can write asking for a review of the Council’s response,

within the next two months, to the Information Management Team at: Arun

District Council, Arun Civic Centre, Maltravers Road, Littlehampton, West

Sussex, BN17 5LF (email [1][Arun District Council request email]).

If, having exhausted our review procedure, you remain dissatisfied with

the handling of your request or complaint, you will have a right to appeal

to the Information Commissioner at: The Information Commissioner's Office,

Wycliffe House, Water Lane, Wilmslow, Cheshire, SK9 5AF (telephone: 0303

123 1113; website [2]www.ico.org.uk). There is no charge for making an

appeal.

Yours sincerely,

Information Management Team

Arun District Council

Dear Mr Cosgrove,

I refer to your Freedom of Information request, logged under July18_36,

which was as follows:-

Please inform me re:

1. Costs to Arun in dealing with the planning applications from the Sir

Richard Hotham Project re Regeneration Proposals for Bognor Regis -

this to include as far as can be ascertained, an estimate of staff

costs.

2. The cost to Arun of the Appeal to the Planning Inspector, also this

to include as far as can be ascertained, an estimate of staff costs.

3. Any award of costs against Arun so far agreed.

4. Income Fee from SRHP for both applications.

Concerning rules re time/cost please comply up to the point that either

rule would apply.

The Council responded to your request on 31 July 2018 as follows:-

RESPONSE:

1. Arun District Council does not record time spent on individual

planning applications and, therefore, the information you have

requested is not held for the purposes of the Freedom of Information

Act 2000.

2. Arun District Council does not record case officer time on appeals and

individual planning applications and, therefore, the information you

have requested is not held for the purposes of the Freedom of

Information Act 2000.

3. No award of costs against Arun District Council has been agreed so

far.

4. BR/26/15/PL = Total fees received = £90,193.00

BR/156/16/PL = No fees received

Arun District Council also received monies for the Planning Performance

Agreement (PPA) income of £16,000

On 31 July 2018, you requested an internal review of your request as

follows:-

I am writing to request an internal review of Arun District Council's

handling of my FOI request 'Costs of consideration of Planning

Applications and Appeal by Sir Richard Hotham Project'.

1. I sought 'estimates' in key areas realising the possible problems of

exact answers or sums. In both the application stages and the appeal,

officers would have spent time and a reasonable estimate of hours

spent could be attempted - the Officers involved will hold such

information and can be requested to make an estimate based on

reasonable assumptions, this must apply especially to the Case Officer

for whom I gather this was an early task in her employment in her

position.

2. I note there is no mention of the fee(s) paid to Design: South East,

please rectify the omission.

3. Can you also, as a supplementary, tell me whether the Council

considered its legal position and appeal prospects on the basis of

legal advice as to percentage estimate of appeal success, if not, why

not and if so, what was such advice?

4. Also, were any other fees expended by the Council to outside persons

etc with regard to this application? If so, to whom and what sums?

Following this request, I have considered the information supplied

initially and can provide the following additional

clarification/information and apologise for the delay:-

1. The first application for the Sir Richard Hotham Project was dealt

with in-house by a Case Officer called D. McEwan; the second

application for the Sir Richard Hotham Project was dealt with by

Claire Potts. Michael Eastham prepared and submitted evidence for the

Hearing and attended the Hearing for the second refused application.

As previously advised, in terms of case officer time, ADC does not

record time spent on individual applications and so it would not be

possible to provide an estimate of staff costs.

2. The Council did refer the second application to Design South East and

ADC were invoiced for £1,322 by Design South East. There was also an

invoice of £1,000 from the Theatres Trust in respect of Advisory

Review for the new theatre.

It should be noted that a request made under either the Freedom of

Information Act 2000 or the Environmental Information Regulations 2004 is

for recorded information held by the Council. There is no requirement for

the Council to produce information to specifically answer an information

request. The Council has stated that it does not record officer time on

specific planning applications and therefore the Council is unable to

provide such information.

With regard to questions 3 and 4 of your request for an internal review,

these are considered to be new questions and are being dealt with

accordingly. You will receive a response to these items at the earliest

opportunity.

As I have concluded the internal review of your information request you

now have the right to appeal to the Information Commissioner if you remain

dissatisfied with the way in which the Council has handled your request.

Appeals should be directed to the Information Commissioner’s Office,

Wycliffe House, Water Lane, Wilmslow, Cheshire SK9 5AF (telephone: 0303

123 1113). More details can be found on the website [1]www.ico.gov.uk

Yours sincerely

Liz Futcher

Data Protection Officer

Dear Mr Cosgrove

Thank you for your Information Request received on 31 August 2018

following an Internal Review to July18_36.

REQUEST:

RE: Costs of consideration of Planning Applications and Appeal by Sir

Richard Hotham Project

1. Can you also, as a supplementary, tell me whether the Council

considered its legal position and appeal prospects on the basis of

legal advice as to percentage estimate of appeal success, if not, why

not and if so, what was such advice?

2. Also, were any other fees expended by the Council to outside persons

etc with regard to this application? If so, to whom and what sums?

RESPONSE:

1. Arun District Council did not consider its legal position and

appeal prospects on the basis of any legal advice as to a percentage

estimate of appeal success.

Officers recommended that planning permission be granted and there would

have been no reason to obtain legal advice at that time on the ‘appeal

prospects’.

It would be a massive resource to seek a legal view of every decision that

is to be taken prior to a potential appeal.

It was the decision of the Development Control Committee

to refuse the application and all relevant information was presented for

consideration at the time of determination. Officers subsequently sought

to defend the decision of the Council at the subsequent appeal.

2. No other fees were expended by the Council to outside persons

with regard to this application.

If you are dissatisfied with the way your request for information has been

handled, you can write asking for a review of the Council’s response,

within the next two months, to the Information Management Team at: Arun

District Council, Arun Civic Centre, Maltravers Road, Littlehampton, West

Sussex, BN17 5LF (email [1][Arun District Council request email]).

If, having exhausted our review procedure, you remain dissatisfied with

the handling of your request or complaint, you will have a right to appeal

to the Information Commissioner at: The Information Commissioner's Office,

Wycliffe House, Water Lane, Wilmslow, Cheshire, SK9 5AF (telephone: 0303

123 1113; website [2]www.ico.org.uk). There is no charge for making an

appeal.

Yours sincerely,
